pageContext.claim: “I haven’t given it any thought. Well, I’ve been reading about it from you people. You say, ‘Oh, I’m going to dismiss him.’ No, I’m not dismissing anybody.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump denied he had given "any thought" to firing special prosecutor Robert Mueller. But then it later emerged that two months earlier he had ordered the firing of Mueller and only backed off when White House Counsel Donald F. McGahn said he would resign if Trump went through with the order.
